properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 12 at 9:08PM CST by NWS Green Bay WI
properties.description:
Light snow will taper off to scattered flurries by late evening.
Any additional snowfall accumulation should be less than an inch.
The combination of the falling snow, along with melting snow
on pavement surfaces earlier this evening and falling air
temperatures well below freezing could lead to icy roads. Gusty
northerly winds may also create some areas of blowing and drifting
snow.

Overnight, temperatures are expected to fall to 5 below to 5 above
zero. The combination of the cold temperatures and gusty northerly
winds will produce wind chill readings in the 10 below to 20
below zero range late tonight into Thursday morning. Wind chill
readings this low can produce frost bite in 30 minutes.

Allow extra travel time if you will be driving tonight as roads
will be slippery due to ice or snow. If venturing outdoors
overnight, wear layers of clothing along with a hat and gloves
to protect yourself from the cold.

NWSheadline: HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS EXPECTED THIS EVENING FOLLOWED BY COLD WIND CHILLS OVERNIGHT
